> Microsoft Fabric FabCon Global Hackathon: Winners Driving AI Innovation
> >

The **Microsoft Fabric FabCon Global Hackathon** brought together developers and data professionals worldwide to build **AI-powered solutions** using **Microsoft Fabric**, the unified data and analytics platform for the era of Artificial Intelligence.

## Why This Matters

Data is the backbone of AI innovation. By leveraging Microsoft Fabric’s unified architecture, participants demonstrated how organizations can:

- **Modernize data estates** for agility and scalability.
- **Harness Real-Time Intelligence** for faster decision-making.
- **Integrate AI seamlessly** into mission-critical workflows.

From **September 16 to November 3, 2025**, participants explored cutting-edge capabilities through weekly livestream learning sessions led by Microsoft experts. Following the momentum from the **Microsoft Fabric Community Conference in Vienna**, this hackathon showcased how Fabric accelerates innovation across **real-time analytics**, **AI-driven applications**, and **data modernization**.

## The Challenge

Participants completed the [Microsoft Fabric Hackathon Skilling Plan](https://aka.ms/FabConHack-SkillingPlan) and built solutions across five distinct categories:

- **Best AI application built with Microsoft Fabric**
- **Best use of AI features**
- **Analytics solutions with Azure Databases or databases in Fabric**
- **Best use of Real-Time Intelligence**
- **Best use of Open Mirroring**

## The Winners

Our judges selected standout solutions based on **innovation, impact, reproducibility, and demo quality. Congratulations to our winners!**

| Winner | Location | Prize Category | Winning Project | Prize | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | **Giacomo C.** | Italy | **Grand Prize** | **HERO — Hybrid Emergency Route Optimizer** | **$2500** | | **Sammy C. Team** | Kenya | **Best AI application built with Microsoft Fabric** | **Smart Waste Management for Dallas City** | **$1500** | | **Paul D.** | United States | **Best use of AI Features** | **FabricAgent – Conversational Prompt Intelligence** | **$1500** | | **Long P. Team** | Vietnam | **Best analytics solutions using Azure Databases or Databases in Fabric** | **Fabric Intelligence: Unified Analytics and RAG** | **$1500** | | **Daniel M.** | Kenya | **Best use of Real-Time Intelligence** | **SmartNexxie – AI-Smart-Parking System** | **$1500** | | **Tyler R.** | United States | **Best use of Open Mirroring** | **Enterprise Finance Migration Accelerator** | **$1500** |

### Grand Prize Winner: HERO — Hybrid Emergency Route Optimizer

HERO (Hybrid Emergency Route Optimizer) is a real-time routing engine for ambulances built on Microsoft Fabric. It solves a critical gap: emergency vehicles need routes optimized for their capabilities—not civilian traffic patterns.

In Lombardy, Italy, ambulances currently use consumer apps like Google Maps, which ignore siren privileges.HERO listens to dispatch events from Mirrored Azure SQL Database and when a dispatch arrives, the Activator triggers a Python notebook that calls Google Routes API for traffic-aware and no-traffic paths. An ML model predicts how much faster a siren-equipped vehicle can drive and selects the best route.

Real-time data streams to Eventstream/KQL, simulates telemetry, and updates a Power BI map for control rooms. HERO can also send SMS alerts with static maps via Fabric Python User Data Functions.

**Impact:** HERO enables predictive dispatching, fleet optimization, emergency analytics, and cross-agency coordination helping improve emergency response efficiency.

**Technologies used:** Microsoft Fabric (Eventstream, KQL DB/Eventhouse, Activator, Notebooks, Lakehouse, UDFs, ML Model), Power BI, Azure Key Vault, Azure SQL Database, Google Routes API, and Twilio.

[**View Project on GitHub**](https://github.com/Data4all-AI/hero)

Our judges were truly impressed by the breadth, depth, and overall quality of the submissions. Explore all winning projects and honorable mentions on [GitHub](https://github.com).

## Category Winners

### **Best AI Application Built with Microsoft Fabric**: **** Smart Waste Management for Dallas City

An AI-powered system built on **Fabric** that optimizes waste collection using real-time analytics and predictive intelligence. It monitors bin levels, predicts capacity, and dynamically adjusts routes reducing overflow, saving fuel, and improving service delivery.

**Impact:** This solution demonstrates how cities can leverage AI and real-time intelligence to deliver smarter municipal services, reduce operational costs, and improve the quality of life for residents.

**Technologies used:** Microsoft Fabric (Data Agents, Eventstream, Eventhouse, Lakehouse, Notebooks), Copilot Studio, Azure Event Hubs, Azure OpenAI, Power BI.

[**View Project on GitHub**](https://github.com/Sammychesire/Smart-City-Waste-Management) ****

### **Best Use of AI Features within Microsoft Fabric**: FabricAgent – Conversational Prompt Intelligence

[**FabricAgent**](https://fabricprompts.com/) speeds up Copilot prompt discovery from 30+ minutes to under 30 seconds with an AI-guided catalog. It combines Microsoft Fabric Data Agents, Open Mirroring, and Azure AI Search for natural-language queries, delivering curated prompts with real-time governance insights.

**Technologies used:** Microsoft Fabric (Data Agents, Eventstream, Eventhouse, Open Mirroring, OneLake), Azure AI Search, Azure OpenAI embeddings, Model Context Protocol server, React 18 + TypeScript, Azure Static Web Apps, GitHub Actions OIDC deployment.

**Impact:** 95% faster prompt discovery (<30 seconds vs. 30+ minutes), leadership-grade telemetry, and enterprise-grade governance layer.

[**View Project on GitHub**](https://github.com/cdrguru/fabricagent-fabcon2025)

### **Best Analytics Solution with Azure or Fabric Databases**: Fabric Intelligence: Unified Analytics and RAG

**Fabric Intelligence** delivers real-time recommendations and unified analytics by integrating streaming and historical data. Its **Agentic RAG engine** combines LLM reasoning with customer reviews for transparent, explainable insights, surfaced through **Power BI dashboards** and a conversational interface.

**Impact:** Turns raw data into actionable insights and trustworthy recommendations.

**Technologies used:** Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, Spark Notebooks, SQL Database), Power BI, Event Hubs, Azure OpenAI.

[**View Project on GitHub**](https://github.com/longphamkhac/Fabric-Intelligence-Unified-Analytics-and-Real-time-RAG-based-Review-Aware-Product-Recommendation)

### **Best Use of Fabric Real-Time Intelligence**: SmartNexxie – AI-Smart-Parking System

SmartNexxie, an end-to-end intelligent parking management system, tackles urban parking headaches with real-time AI prediction and blockchain-verified data. Using computer vision (YOLOv8), IoT sensors, and RAG-based forecasting, it predicts parking availability and streams insights via Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Intelligence and Power BI dashboards.

**Impact:** SmartNexxie creates smarter cities by increasing revenue for operators, providing stress-free experiences for drivers, and demonstrating how real-time intelligence can transform urban infrastructure management.

**Technologies:** Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, EventStream, Eventhouse, Real-Time Intelligence), YOLOv8, PySpark, Vector Embeddings, MCP Governance, Power BI, Azure OpenAI, blockchain verification.

[**View Project on GitHub**](https://github.com/danielmuthama23/SmartNexxie--Microsoft-Fabcon-Global-Hack-AI-Smart-Parking)

### **Best Use of Open Mirroring**: Enterprise Finance Migration Accelerator

This solution enables zero-downtime migration from Snowflake to Microsoft Fabric using Open Mirroring, moving 45.5M records in 60 seconds with full data fidelity. It automates RBAC sync, validates schema integrity, and delivers 85%+ cost savings vs. Snowflake, eliminating migration risk for mission-critical finance systems.

**Impact:** Confident, seamless migration with automated security and verified ROI.

**Technologies:** Microsoft Fabric (Open Mirroring, Lakehouse, SQL Analytics), Power Automate, Snowflake, Python.

[**View the Project in GitHub**](https://github.com/tyler-migration/enterprise-finance-migration-accelerator)

## Honorable Mentions

We received incredible submissions; here are five standout projects worth exploring:

### Property Agentic AI

24/7 AI voice concierge built for real estate, delivers instant property info and predictive buyer insights aiming to improve customer experience and accelerate property sales. **Technologies used:** Microsoft Fabric (Data Science notebooks, Lakehouse), Azure SQL, LangChain, GPT-4o-mini.

[**View Project on GitHub**](https://github.com/sahirmaharaj/ai-agent) **|** [**Watch Demo Video**](https://youtu.be/Po7Fhs01Jy4)

### Multi-Agentic AI City Simulation

Gamified city management with autonomous AI agents using real-time data and Fabric Eventstreams. Enables smarter urban planning and faster issue resolution. **Technologies used:** Microsoft Fabric (Eventstream, Eventhouse, Data Agent/Copilot, Real-Time Intelligence), Azure OpenAI, multi-agent collaboration (Swarm pattern), Azure Container Apps.

[**Watch Demo Video**](https://youtu.be/ef3Mq-Ko08g) **|** [**Check out the App**](https://smartcity-frontend.orangeisland-ee41ad31.centralindia.azurecontainerapps.io/)

### Smart City Quest using Fabric Real-Time Intelligence

Real-time dashboards and ML forecasting for traffic and weather analytics across five cities helps improve traffic management and environmental planning.

**Technologies:** Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse with Medallion architecture, Eventhouse, EventStream, Eventhub, Notebooks, Dataflow Gen2, Pipelines, Real-time Dashboard, Activator, ML Model), Power BI.

[**View Project on GitHub**](https://github.com/Parmjeet2020/smart-city-quest) **|** [**Watch Demo Video**](https://youtu.be/yc8KnpeseXY)

### Project AutoLake – Self-Updating Data & AI Insights

Self-updating data pipelines using Fabric Open Mirroring for zero downtime and instant insights. Project AutoLake helps eliminate pipeline maintenance and accelerates analytics.

**Technologies:** Microsoft Fabric (Open Mirroring, Lakehouse, Data Agent), Azure AI Agent Service, automated schema detection.

[**View Project on GitHub**](https://github.com/shreyasrastogi/fabric-salesdata-mirroring-agent-demo/) **|** [**Watch Demo Video**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8CsWRyvskYE)

### Seamless & Secure Data Mirroring: Databricks to Fabric

Self-updating data pipelines using Fabric Open Mirroring for zero downtime and instant insights. This solution helps eliminate pipeline maintenance and accelerates analytics.

**Technologies used:** Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, OneLake), Azure Databricks, event-based triggers, and Python.

[**View Project on GitHub**](https://github.com/NandanHegde15/MSFTFabric-Projects/tree/main/ADB%20Mirror) **|** [**Watch Demo Video**](https://youtu.be/mM3a0Bt-Vd8?si=nMDTVnt6dsIagbY6)

## Keep your Fabric Momentum going: Learn, Level-Up and Connect

**Happening Now: Take the Fabric Skills Challenge**Level up your data and AI expertise with the Microsoft Fabric Ignite Skills Challenge. Complete learning modules, earn badges, and unlock the door to becoming Fabric Certified!

- [**DP-600 Fabric Data Analytics Engineer Challenge**](https://aka.ms/Ignite-FabricDataAnalyticsChallenge)
- [**DP-700 Fabric Data Engineer Challenge**](https://aka.ms/Ignite-FabricDataEngineerChallenge)

**Join Fabric Data Days**50 days of deep learning with live sessions, expert insights, and certification discounts.

[Register for Fabric Data Days](https://aka.ms/FabricDataDays)

**Join us at FabCon Atlanta**

Use the code FABHACK to **save $200 on your**[**FabCon Atlanta**](https://aka.ms/fabcon) registration.

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Microsoft-Fabric-Data-Hackathon_Winner-Banner-1.png)

**Thank you to everyone who joined the Microsoft Fabric FabCon Global Hackathon!** Your creativity made this event incredible. Special thanks to our judges for selecting winners from so many outstanding submissions.

**Share your thoughts in the comments, what solution inspired you most?**
